N/A (No alcohol has been consumed and BAC is 0.00).
N/A (No alcohol has been consumed and BAC is 0.00).
No apparent effects. Slight mood elevation.
Outside effects 1: In Washington, you will test as legally impaired at .02% BAC if you are under 21. It is illegal to drive or bike at this level.
Feeling of relaxation. Sensation of warmth. Minor impairment of reasoning and memory.
Outside effects 2.
Mild impairment of balance, speech, vision and control.
Outside effects 3: In all 50 states, it is illegal to drive or bike at .08%.
Significant impairment of motor coordination and loss of judgment. Speech may be slurred.
Outside effects 4
Gross impairment of motor control. Blurred vision and major loss of balance. Onset of dysphoria (anxiety, restlessness).
Outside effects 5
Dysphoria predominates. Nausea may appear.
Outside effects 6: Drinker has the appearance of "sloppy drunk."
Severe intoxication. Mental confusion. Dysphoria with nausea and some vomiting.
Outside effects 7: Need assistance walking.
Loss of consciousness. Brink of coma.
Outside effects 8
Onset of coma. Likelihood of death due to respiratory failure.
